Class XmlIndexSpecification

Encapsulates the indexing specification of a container.

Inheritance
System.Object
XmlIndexSpecification
Implements
System.IDisposable
Inherited Members
System.Object.ToString()
System.Object.Equals(System.Object)

System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.GetHashCode()
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public sealed class XmlIndexSpecification : IDisposable
Remarks

An indexing specification can be retrieved with the GetIndexSpecification() method, and modified using the SetIndexSpecification(XmlIndexSpecification, UpdateContext) method.

The XmlIndexSpecification class provides an interface for manipulating the indexing specification through the XmlIndexSpecification.addIndex, XmlIndexSpecification.deleteIndex, and XmlIndexSpecification.replaceIndex methods. The class interface also provides the XmlIndexSpecification.next and XmlIndexSpecification.reset methods for iterating through the specified indices. The XmlIndexSpecification.find method can be used to search for the indexing strategy for a known node.

Finally, you can set a default index specification for a container using XmlIndexSpecification.addDefaultIndex. You can replace and delete the default index using XmlIndexSpecification.replaceDefaultIndex and XmlIndexSpecification.deleteDefaultIndex.

Note that adding an index to a container results in re-indexing all of the documents in that container, which can take a very long time. It is good practice to design an application to add useful indices before populating a container.

The class is implemented using a handle-body idiom. When a handle is copied, both handles maintain a reference to the same body.

Properties

View Source

AutoIndexing

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the auto-indexing state which will affect the container when set using SetIndexSpecification(XmlIndexSpecification, UpdateContext).

Declaration
public bool AutoIndexing { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
Remarks

If the value on the container is true (the default for newly-created containers) then indexes are added automatically for leaf elements and attributes. The indexes added are "node-equality-string" and "node-equality-double" for elements and attributes. If auto-indexing is not desired it should be disabled using this interface upon container creation.

Auto-indexing is recognized by insertion of new documents as well as updates of existing documents, including modification via XQuery Update. The auto-indexing state is persistent and will remain stable across container close/re-open operations. Indexes added via auto-indexing are normal indexes and can be removed using the normal mechanisms.

A significant implication of auto-indexing is that any operation that may add an index (e.g. PutDocument(String, UpdateContext)) can have the side effect of re-indexing the entire container. For this reason auto-indexing is not recommended for containers of heterogeneous documents and that it be disabled once a representative set of documents has been inserted.

Methods

View Source

AddDefaultIndex(IndexingStrategy)

Adds an indexing strategy to the default index specification. That is, the index provided on this method is applied to all nodes in a container, except for those for which an explicit index is already declared.

Declaration
public void AddDefaultIndex(IndexingStrategy index)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IndexingStrategy index

The index to specify as the default index.
Remarks

For more information on specifying indexing strategies, see AddIndex(XmlIndex).

Remarks

DeleteIndex(String, String, String)

Deletes an index for a named document or metadata node.

Declaration
public void DeleteIndex(string nodeNamespace, string nodeName, string index)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String nodeNamespace

The namespace of the node for which you want the index deleted. The default namespace is selected by passing an empty string for the namespace.
System.String nodeName

The name of the indexed element or attribute node.
System.String index

The indexing strategy of the index to remove.
Remarks

To delete an index set for metadata, specify the URI and name used when the metadata was added to the document.

Type Description
System.String

The string representation of the default index.
Remarks

The default index is the index used by all nodes in the document in the absence of any other index.

Remarks
